Hi,

> And I'm quite certain that list activity DOES play a
> role in how many people
> join the list.  I know that if the topic of a list
> sounds interesting, but
> there is very little activity, I won't bother to
> join.

So let's have a policy of the established people
posting fake messages so that the group always looks
busy to the casual glance.

I mean they have to be messages on genuine subjects,
but not necessarily ones that we want to discuss right
now.

To avoid the regulars getting bogged down, we could
use some sort of encoding in the title line, something
that'll look relevant but acutally never comes up, I
know, how about "Darwin"...

    Ian

p.s. JOKE!
